definition: threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: But I knew I had to get past this nervousness.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我知道必须先解决怯场的问题。

sentences.english: Read some of the excellent books on stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 读几本克服怯场情绪的好书。

sentences.english: Insecurity and lack of self-confidence lead to stage fright and performance anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏安全感和自信是导致怯场和紧张的元凶。

sentences.english: Stage fright in public performance is the result of the contradiction and conflict.
sentences.chinese: 公开演奏中的怯场现象就是这种矛盾和冲突的产物。

sentences.english: The student got stage fright when he stepped into the exam room.
sentences.chinese: 学生一踏进考试室就有点怯场。

sentences.english: The good news is that you can conquer stage fright and get rid of it permanently.
sentences.chinese: 好消息是，你能够克服怯场和摆脱它永远。

sentences.english: Even great speakers may sometimes get stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 即便是著名的演说家，也有怯场的时候。

sentences.english: I myself, a rather shy person by nature who easily suffers from stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 我本人天性相当内向，很容易怯场。

sentences.english: Yeah, the height and speed gave her cold feet.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，过山车又高又快，吓得她怯场。

sentences.english: He acted in an unhurried manner and didn't have any stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 表现得从容自若，一点都不怯场。

sentences.english: The fact that the same guy pukes on me every year from stage fright.
sentences.chinese: 因为有个鸟人每年都因为怯场而吐在我身上。

sentences.english: He'll bottle out when he goes on the stage.
Nervous illness can stem from being treated inconsiderately in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 怯场是因为小时候受到了轻率的对待所致。

sentences.english: The actress had to learn to get over her fear of the public.
sentences.chinese: 这位女演员必须学会不怯场。

sentences.english: She went up on her lines out of fear on opening night.
sentences.chinese: 上演首晚她因怯场忘记了台词。

sentences.english: Sometimes I still suffer from stage fright.

definition: to display one's ignorance/to make a fool of oneself by an ignorant blunder
(of one's conduct, speech etc) natural and unrestrained
lit. newborn calves do not fear tigers (idiom)/fig. the young are fearless
pinyin: chu1 sheng1 niu2 du2 bu4 pa4 hu3

definition: handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to handle matters with ease (idiom)/to hold one's own
able to reply quickly and fluently (idiom); having a ready answer
